name: 13ft-ladder
description: 13ft is an open-source, self-hosted web service designed as a replacement for 12ft.io. It allows you to input a URL and retrieve the article’s full content—bypassing ads and paywalls, by emulating a GoogleBot crawl to fetch what search engines see. Built in Python (Flask) and easily deployable via Docker, it’s geared toward users who want more control over accessing web content and hosting their own instance. The project is MIT-licensed, with support for custom host/port setups, and has a community of users and contributors.
features: Paywall Bypass: Access full article content without subscriptions or ads. Read freely without restrictions.
Self-Hosted Control: Run on your own server for complete data privacy. Your reading, your infrastructure.
Simple Usage: Just paste any URL to retrieve the complete article text. One-click access to content.
Smart Technology: Mimics search engine crawlers to access public content. Leverages existing web standards.
Easy Deployment: Docker support enables quick installation and setup. Running in minutes.
Customizable: Configure host and port settings to match your needs. Flexible server options.
Open Source: MIT licensed with active community contributions. Free and transparent.
